taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family asteraceae;tribe heliantheae;subtribe coreopsidinae;genus coreopsis;section coreopsis;species nuecensis

bio:treatment.description: Annuals, 10–30(–50+) cm. Aerial nodes proximal to first peduncle usually 1–3(–5), distalmost 1–3 internodes 2–4(–9+) cm. Leaves: basal and cauline on proximal 1/5–1/3(–1/2) of plant heights; petioles 1–8+ cm; blades simple or 1(–2)-pinnately lobed, simple blades or terminal lobes ± elliptic to lanceolate, 10–30 × 5–15 mm. Peduncles (5–)10–25+ cm. Calyculi of ± deltate to lance-oblong bractlets 4–6(–8) mm. Phyllaries lance-oblong, 6–8(–10+) mm. Ray laminae yellow, usually each with (2–)4–8+ proximal, red-brown or purple flecks, 12–18+ mm. Disc corollas 2.5–3.2 mm, apices yellow. Cypselae 2.5–4 mm, wings spreading, ± chartaceous, entire. 2n = 12, 14, 18, 20.
Sandy soils in post-oak and oak-mesquite woodlands;
bio:treatment.discussion: Coreopsis nuecensis is probably in Mexico (Tamaulipas) and was collected once in Florida (“Escaped from cultivation”). Plants with glabrous phyllaries and chromosome numbers of 2n = 18 and 20 and included here in C. nuecensis have been called C. nuecensoides.
